020import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
021
022/**
023 * ChoreTime represents a time for a {@link Chore}.
024 *
025 * @author creatorfromhell
026 * @see Chore
027 * @since 0.1.2.0
028 */
029public class ChoreTime {
030
031  private final int time;
032  private final TimeUnit unit;
033
034  public ChoreTime(int ticks) {
035
036    this.time = ticks;
037
038    //We set our unit to null for ticks.
039    this.unit = null;
040  }
041
042  public ChoreTime(int time, TimeUnit unit) {
043
044    this.time = time;
045    this.unit = unit;
046  }
047
048  public long asSeconds() {
049
050    if(unit == null) {
051      //this is ticks since our unit is null, so we have to divide by 20
052      return (time / 20);
053    }
054    return unit.toSeconds(time);
055  }
056
057  public long asTicks() {
058
059    if(unit == null) {
060      //this is ticks since our unit is null, so we just return it
061      return time;
062    }
063    return (unit.toSeconds(time) * 20);
064  }
065
066  public int getTime() {
067
068    return time;
069  }
070}
